intro: Lomagramma abscondita, commonly known as the hidden lichen, is a rare and elusive species belonging to the family Lichenes. It is characterized by its unique symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga or cyanobacterium. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its morphology includes a crust-like thallus that is often difficult to distinguish from the substrate it inhabits. Due to its cryptic nature and limited distribution, Lomagramma abscondita remains a subject of ongoing botanical research.
